member.summary: The ID of the object that the update is for.

member.summary: The ID of the client defined data definition.

member.name: P:CTrue.FsConnect.FsDataReceivedEventArgs.Flags
member.summary: The flags that were set for this data request, see SimConnect_RequestDataOnSimObject for a description of the flags. This parameter will always be set to zero if the call was SimConnect_RequestDataOnSimObjectType.

member.name: P:CTrue.FsConnect.FsDataReceivedEventArgs.EntryNumber
member.summary: If multiple objects are being returned, this is the index number of this object out of a total of . This will always be 1 if the call was SimConnect_RequestDataOnSimObject, and can be 0 or more if the call was SimConnect_RequestDataOnSimObjectType.

member.name: P:CTrue.FsConnect.FsDataReceivedEventArgs.OutOf
member.summary: The total number of objects being returned. Note that and start with 1 not 0, so if two objects are being returned and pairs will be 1,2 and 2,2 for the two objects. This will always be 1 if the call was SimConnect_RequestDataOnSimObject, and can be 0 or more if the call was SimConnect_RequestDataOnSimObjectType.

member.name: P:CTrue.FsConnect.FsDataReceivedEventArgs.DefineCount
member.summary: The number of items in the data list.

member.name: T:CTrue.FsConnect.FsConnectPeriod
member.summary: Describes how often data should be returned.

member.name: F:CTrue.FsConnect.FsConnectPeriod.Never
member.summary: Specifies that the data is not to be sent.

member.name: F:CTrue.FsConnect.FsConnectPeriod.Once
member.summary: Specifies that the data should be sent once only. Note that this is not an efficient way of receiving data frequently, use one of the other periods if there is a regular frequency to the data request.

member.name: F:CTrue.FsConnect.FsConnectPeriod.VisualFrame
member.summary: Specifies that the data should be sent every visual (rendered) frame.

member.name: F:CTrue.FsConnect.FsConnectPeriod.SimFrame
member.summary: Specifies that the data should be sent every simulated frame, whether that frame is rendered or not.

member.name: F:CTrue.FsConnect.FsConnectPeriod.Second
member.summary: Specifies that the data should be sent once every second.

member.name: F:CTrue.FsConnect.FsConnectDRequestFlag.Default
member.summary: The default, data will be sent strictly according to the defined period.

member.name: F:CTrue.FsConnect.FsConnectDRequestFlag.Changed
member.summary: Data will only be sent to the client when one or more values have changed. If this is the only flag set, then all the variables in a data definition will be returned if just one of the values changes.

member.name: F:CTrue.FsConnect.FsConnectDRequestFlag.Tagged
member.summary: Requested data will be sent in tagged format (datum ID/value pairs). Tagged format requires that a datum reference ID is returned along with the data value, in order that the client code is able to identify the variable. This flag is usually set in conjunction with the previous flag, but it can be used on its own to return all the values in a data definition in datum ID/value pairs. See the SIMCONNECT_RECV_SIMOBJECT_DATA structure for more details.

This is typically used to allow some keyboard entry to a complex device such as a GPS to enter such things as ICAO codes using the keyboard, rather than turning dials.

member.name: F:CTrue.FsConnect.FsEventNameId.FreezeLatitudeLongitudeToggle
member.summary: Turns the freezing of the lat/lon position of the aircraft (either user or AI controlled) on or off. If this key event is set, it means that the latitude and longitude of the aircraft are not being controlled by ESP, so enabling, for example, a SimConnect client to control the position of the aircraft. This can also apply to altitude and attitude. Refer to the simulation variables: IS LATITUDE LONGITUDE FREEZE ON, IS ALTITUDE FREEZE ON, and IS ATTITUDE FREEZE ON Refer also to the SimConnect_AIReleaseControl function.

member.name: P:CTrue.FsConnect.IFsConnect.SimConnectFileLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets where to write the SimConnect.cfg file, that specifies how to connect to Flight Simulator. By default set to local.
member.remarks: The default beghavior is to write the file to the same location as the executing assembly, but this may cause problems if the application does not have write access to this location. As an alternative the file can be written to My Document, but this may cause issues with other SimConnect using applications.

member.name: M:CTrue.FsConnect.IFsConnect.Connect(System.String,System.String,System.UInt32,CTrue.FsConnect.SimConnectProtocol)
member.summary: Connects to Flight Simulator on the specified host name and port.
member.param: A name identifying this client to Flight Simulator.
A hostname or IP address.
A TCP or pipe port number.
The protocol to use to connect to Flight Simulator.
member.remarks: A SimConnect.cfg file will be generated containing connection information. Flight Simulator must be configured for remote connections by editing the SimConnect.xml file that are part of the installation.
